item.title: User Training: A Low-Tech Solution to Phishing
item.description:
This article was originally posted to the Strongarm blog in 2017 and has been reposted here on my personal site. Many of the links and resources are broken, but the content is still valid.

Early in my career, I was an active naysayer against “security awareness training.” The idea that …
item.dc:creator: Stephen DiCato

item.title: Learning to Weld
item.description:
I've always had an interest in welding and metal fabrication, especially as tools used to restore and customize cars. I took a 10 week introductory welding class last fall. Below are my unedited notes and pictures from each week.

I'm taking a beginner welding class at the local vocational school …
item.dc:creator: Stephen DiCato

item.title: Onboarding Engineers
item.description: Percipient Networks sponsored DjangoCon 2015. While there, I proposed a lightning talk on onboarding engineers. Due to time I was not able to actually present. However, the content is available on GitHub including a rendered PDF of the slides.
item.dc:creator: Stephen DiCato

item.title: Boston Python - Twisted Concepts & Patterns
item.description:
Patrick Cloke and I recently gave a talk at Boston Python meetup about the Twisted Networking Framework. It was an introductory to intermediate level talk based on our experiences using Twisted at Percipient Networks.

The slides and example code are available on GitHub. There is a rendered PDF for convenience …
item.dc:creator: Stephen DiCato
